required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Muscle Ischemia in Arterial Claudication (Tsingtao)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation de l'Ischemie Musculaire au Cours de l'Artériopathie Oblitérante Des Membres Inférieurs

brief_summary.textblock: The goal is to compare the results observed in patients that had both an exercise oximetry and a thallium scintigraphy for lower limb claudication

detailed_description.textblock: On our routine pratice, patients suffering claudication (specifically atypical claudication or claudication of doubful vascular origin) have exercise oximetry to prove the vascular origin of pain. If still doubtful (inconsistency of pain and oximetry results) patients are referred for thallium scintigraphy. Our goal is to compare the results issued from these two test

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation of thallium scintigraphy to oximetry results
primary_outcome.description: The coefficient of correlation of DROP values to normalized late to early changes in radioactivity wil be calculated at the calf and buttock level

intervention.description: transcutaneous oxygen pressure is measured at the skin level on chest , buttocks and calves during a walking test 3.2 km*:h 10% slope. From the test result the decrease from rest of oxygen pressure (DROP) index is calculated to estimate muscle ischemia

Muscle thallium fixation is measured immediately after a walking test 3.2 km*:h 10% slope and at 4 hours after the test. From the test result the difference of late and early radioactivity is calculated at the buttock and calf level and normalized to total body radioactivity to estimate muscle ischemia

study_pop.textblock: Patients referred for claudication of suspected arterial

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Claudication suspected of arterial origin
Exclusion Criteria:
- missing endopoint value
